item.title: Pictures | Words Exhibition
item.description: I was invited to do a solo show at Wolves in Johannesburg, South Africa. I produced a range on type and image based pieces in various mediums including layered, laser engraved & die cut wood, lino cuts, scratch board illustrations and ink paintings. I tend to forget to properly scan and document work before sending it to shows, so this is mainly a collection of random photos, detail shots and process images.
item.content:encoded: I was invited to do a solo show at Wolves in Johannesburg, South Africa. I produced a range on type and image based pieces in various mediums including layered, laser engraved & die cut wood, lino cuts, scratch board illustrations and ink paintings. I tend to forget to properly scan and document work before sending it to shows, so this is mainly a collection of random photos, detail shots and process images.

item.title: BMW Sales Tool
item.description: Pitch presentation for a transnational Sales-Tool for BMW car dealers. The Intranet Website enables car dealers from all over the world to get instant access to News and technical knowledge. In addition the car dealers have the opportunity to exchange knowledge with other car dealers and BMW experts.
item.content:encoded: Pitch presentation for a transnational Sales-Tool for BMW car dealers. The Intranet Website enables car dealers from all over the world to get instant access to News and technical knowledge. In addition the car dealers have the opportunity to exchange knowledge with other car dealers and BMW experts.

item.title: Wired Magazine [ITA] | How To
item.description: A selection of small illustrations that I've made for Wired Magazine Italia, under the art direction of Daniela Sanziani.
item.content:encoded: A selection of small illustrations that I've made for Wired Magazine Italia, under the art direction of Daniela Sanziani.

item.title: 7FT Gundam - Ultimate Papercraft
item.description: After burning my 4FT Freedom Gundam papercraft in 2010 I was determined to create a bigger and better replacement. This 7FT Gundam Mk-2 papercraft became the result of my goal, made up of 1250 parts on 720 pages, for a total paper weight of 10lb (4.5kg).
item.content:encoded: After burning my 4FT Freedom Gundam papercraft in 2010 I was determined to create a bigger and better replacement. This 7FT Gundam Mk-2 papercraft became the result of my goal, made up of 1250 parts on 720 pages, for a total paper weight of 10lb (4.5kg).

item.title: Hair
item.description: Christophe Martinez trouve son inspiration dans la pratique des arts plastiques en général. Deux motifs semblent particulièrement marquer ses oeuvres : son rapport à limage et la manipulation dobjets. Après avoir obtenu son diplôme de coiffeur, il participe et remporte plusieurs concours artistiques. Son désir de créer le conduit à Paris où il travaille en studio pour lOréal, Revlon, Nuxe Captivé par la matière organique, il aiguise son travail en tant que plasticien développant une série de photographies ( technique du copy-art ) par le biais de la manipulation génétique avec des objets biomécaniques tel que le zip-prothèse. Sa démarche met en relation lun des composants humain et ses représentations, grâce à lutilisation dune matière unique : le cheveu. En utilisant cette matière, distinctive à lhomme, il veut nous indiquer par ses diverses manipulations que le cheveu est une matière chargée en énergie, vibrant au contact de la lumière. Celui-ci peut transcender des objets ou autres installations et leur offrir une âme propre à chacun. Dans la première exposition du genre ( Galerie 59, Rivoli Paris ), il sinscrit dans une démarche minimaliste. Simplifiant la composition à lextrême, il travaille et joue avec différentes teintes lumineuses variant du brillant au mat. Pour ses installations, le cheveu disposé puis compressé sous verre, renvoie à la technique du « copy-art ». Lartiste, au travers de ses oeuvres, porte une réflexion pointue et actuelle en boulversant les codes picturaux ainsi que les critères esthétiques de lhistoire. Dans lexposition « 10th Arch To Fétiçio », 10 Gates Gallery à Londres, il aborde une nouvelle démarche en choisissant comme support un objet de nature morte. Le processus utilise la matière comme revêtement organique. A la fois tissé, clouté, infiltré dans et sur lobjet, celui-ci est sublimé par la texture du cheveu, comme métamorphosé. Certaines des installations de lartiste dégagent un univers singulier autour des natures mortes. Elles sen trouvent personnifiées. Expositions: 2011: Exposition collective, Galerie Brissot, Paris Expositon collective, Bastille Design Center, Paris 2010: Exposition collective, Galerie 59, Paris Exposition collective, Atelier du Figuier, Paris Exposition personnelle, 10 Gales Gallery, Londres
item.content:encoded: Christophe Martinez trouve son inspiration dans la pratique des arts plastiques en général. Deux motifs semblent particulièrement marquer ses oeuvres : son rapport à limage et la manipulation dobjets. Après avoir obtenu son diplôme de coiffeur, il participe et remporte plusieurs concours artistiques. Son désir de créer le conduit à Paris où il travaille en studio pour lOréal, Revlon, Nuxe Captivé par la matière organique, il aiguise son travail en tant que plasticien développant une série de photographies ( technique du copy-art ) par le biais de la manipulation génétique avec des objets biomécaniques tel que le zip-prothèse. Sa démarche met en relation lun des composants humain et ses représentations, grâce à lutilisation dune matière unique : le cheveu. En utilisant cette matière, distinctive à lhomme, il veut nous indiquer par ses diverses manipulations que le cheveu est une matière chargée en énergie, vibrant au contact de la lumière. Celui-ci peut transcender des objets ou autres installations et leur offrir une âme propre à chacun. Dans la première exposition du genre ( Galerie 59, Rivoli Paris ), il sinscrit dans une démarche minimaliste. Simplifiant la composition à lextrême, il travaille et joue avec différentes teintes lumineuses variant du brillant au mat. Pour ses installations, le cheveu disposé puis compressé sous verre, renvoie à la technique du « copy-art ». Lartiste, au travers de ses oeuvres, porte une réflexion pointue et actuelle en boulversant les codes picturaux ainsi que les critères esthétiques de lhistoire. Dans lexposition « 10th Arch To Fétiçio », 10 Gates Gallery à Londres, il aborde une nouvelle démarche en choisissant comme support un objet de nature morte. Le processus utilise la matière comme revêtement organique. A la fois tissé, clouté, infiltré dans et sur lobjet, celui-ci est sublimé par la texture du cheveu, comme métamorphosé. Certaines des installations de lartiste dégagent un univers singulier autour des natures mortes. Elles sen trouvent personnifiées. Expositions: 2011: Exposition collective, Galerie Brissot, Paris Expositon collective, Bastille Design Center, Paris 2010: Exposition collective, Galerie 59, Paris Exposition collective, Atelier du Figuier, Paris Exposition personnelle, 10 Gales Gallery, Londres

item.title: 15 years VIB: Event and 9 Books
item.description: For VIB's fifteenth anniversary, we did the entire event branding, for which we used only chalk and a huge blackboard. For this event we also designed a box with nine books in it. For the books only we made more then 200 large chalk drawings.
item.content:encoded: For VIB's fifteenth anniversary, we did the entire event branding, for which we used only chalk and a huge blackboard. For this event we also designed a box with nine books in it. For the books only we made more then 200 large chalk drawings.

item.title: Minimalist effect in the maximalist market
item.description: Antrepo's last project is about simplicity and we try to find alternate simple versions for some package samples of the international brands. We think almost every product needs some review for minimal feeling.
item.content:encoded: Antrepo's last project is about simplicity and we try to find alternate simple versions for some package samples of the international brands. We think almost every product needs some review for minimal feeling.

item.title: Castaways
item.description: I start with digital photos I've taken and use those images as inspiration for the characters and stories I want to tell. I then draw the characters out in ink (in the same perspective as the photo) and scan that drawing into Photoshop where I digitally paint all the color and texture, doing my best to match the lighting in the photo.
item.content:encoded: I start with digital photos I've taken and use those images as inspiration for the characters and stories I want to tell. I then draw the characters out in ink (in the same perspective as the photo) and scan that drawing into Photoshop where I digitally paint all the color and texture, doing my best to match the lighting in the photo.

item.title: OFFF 2011 - Let's Feed the Future
item.description: Tittle sequence for the OFFF TOUR festival held in Cincinnati in October 2011 in the Contemporary Arts Center. OFFF is a post-digital culture festival, a meeting place to host contemporary creation through an in depth programme of conferences, workshops and performances by the most relevant artists of our time. Produced and Art Directed by Vasava Directed & Edited by Gregory Hervelin Director of Photography: Carles Mestres Music: Chapelier Fou Speakers: Lernert & Sander, The Mill, Joshua Davis. Brosmind, Hyperquake, Lauren Edwards & Mattie, Vasava. Cast: Comglas, Ricardo Rousselot, Montserrat Plius, Jaume Sans, Papabubble, Joan Pujagut, Marc Monzó, J. Ordóñez & Zéphyr Hervelin-Herrou Produced by: Bruno Sellés, Gregory Hervelin, Antoni Sellés, Enric Godes, Not For Production Color correction: Utopic Shot on location in Barcelona
item.content:encoded: Tittle sequence for the OFFF TOUR festival held in Cincinnati in October 2011 in the Contemporary Arts Center. OFFF is a post-digital culture festival, a meeting place to host contemporary creation through an in depth programme of conferences, workshops and performances by the most relevant artists of our time. Produced and Art Directed by Vasava Directed & Edited by Gregory Hervelin Director of Photography: Carles Mestres Music: Chapelier Fou Speakers: Lernert & Sander, The Mill, Joshua Davis. Brosmind, Hyperquake, Lauren Edwards & Mattie, Vasava. Cast: Comglas, Ricardo Rousselot, Montserrat Plius, Jaume Sans, Papabubble, Joan Pujagut, Marc Monzó, J. Ordóñez & Zéphyr Hervelin-Herrou Produced by: Bruno Sellés, Gregory Hervelin, Antoni Sellés, Enric Godes, Not For Production Color correction: Utopic Shot on location in Barcelona

item.title: Warm Signal
item.description: A short abstract movie dealing with nature and maritime creatures, metamorphosis and transformation it connects art and science. Strong emphasis on sound, related to the idea of visual music. The Style is soft but clean, focussing on black & white.
item.content:encoded: A short abstract movie dealing with nature and maritime creatures, metamorphosis and transformation it connects art and science. Strong emphasis on sound, related to the idea of visual music. The Style is soft but clean, focussing on black & white.

item.title: Web & ID for Long Story Production
item.description: Long Story is the video production company. The main directions are music videos and commercials. Long Story web-site Longstory.ru is built as a large video player videos and clips are becoming the one big film companys show-real. All dynamics is implemented by java script. Identity uses the same principle. Timeline is the central element of identity. Minimalistic & clean.
item.content:encoded: Long Story is the video production company. The main directions are music videos and commercials. Long Story web-site Longstory.ru is built as a large video player videos and clips are becoming the one big film companys show-real. All dynamics is implemented by java script. Identity uses the same principle. Timeline is the central element of identity. Minimalistic & clean.

item.title: 76 Synthesizer - Final
item.description: 76 Synthesizer is a virtual analog monophonic synth for the iPad. Inspired by synthesizers from the 70's, the 76 Synthesizer combines playability with style. For a limited time only, get 76 Synthesizer for 50% off! Features: Three Oscillators with sine, sawtooth, triangle, square waves and switchable filter LFO. Voltage controlled filter ADSR Glide Pitch bend/modulation touch pad Three octave touch pad for note input with nine different scales Eight different effects: reverb, phaser, flanger, chorus, overdrive, delay, tremolo and vocoder tap the outputs to patch into two effects simultaneously Eight different writable presets Stunning retro interface
item.content:encoded: 76 Synthesizer is a virtual analog monophonic synth for the iPad. Inspired by synthesizers from the 70's, the 76 Synthesizer combines playability with style. For a limited time only, get 76 Synthesizer for 50% off! Features: Three Oscillators with sine, sawtooth, triangle, square waves and switchable filter LFO. Voltage controlled filter ADSR Glide Pitch bend/modulation touch pad Three octave touch pad for note input with nine different scales Eight different effects: reverb, phaser, flanger, chorus, overdrive, delay, tremolo and vocoder tap the outputs to patch into two effects simultaneously Eight different writable presets Stunning retro interface
